articles.title: Some Canadians are stranded in Peru as civil unrest over president's ouster continues - CBC News
articles.description: Thousands of Canadians are currently in Peru, where Pedro Castillo's removal from office ignited a wave of protests across the South American nation. Some have tried to leave the country since the protests began, but violent confrontations have crippled trave…
articles.content: Carolina Medina arrived in Peru on Dec. 3. But the Canadian tourist would soon be caught in the country's political crossfire, as just four days later, its president's removal from office ignited a w… [+4287 chars]
